intro: Eremiastrum orcuttii, commonly known as Orcutt's needlegrass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, pointed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Eremiastrum orcuttii is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is considered a valuable plant for stabilizing soils in desert ecosystems.
